Articles.Content:
Hi folks,

Better late than never.... just saw a thread about this game on my motorbike forum - ! slightly off topic ! - but looked like fun... and it is

I\'m obviously never going to be a great rocket scientist however as I seem to be failing at the tutorial.... I can launch and fly a rocket, but it doesn\'t seem to recognise a succesful landing (soon lets me know when I\'ve blown stuff up, mind!) as the end of a mission - I can land on land or sea, the \'chute comes off and the capsule bobs forever unless I esc and then it gives me 'manual override' to end... and starts the tutorial again next time I\'m on the pad.

Am I missing something, or is this how it\'s supposed to be in this version? I had a good look through the forums and searched but couldn\'t find anything relevant....

It used to log landings and end the session with a Mission Accomplished! on the mission log, but some oddities with it recording the event every second upon touchdown made it bothersome to read through the log so it was omitted for the meantime.
Fair enough At least I know it\'s not me, then Next stop, orbit! (Or another explosive power-dive )

Welcome to the KSP Forums!

Happy Launching!

Arrr!

Capt\'n Skunky

That\'s pretty much all there is in this version. Once your capsule is back on the ground, you can esc-end mission, not much else left to do.

In the meantime, my usual plug for my tutorial. http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/index.php?topic=4137.0

Hello Friends.

I have nothing of value to post except that I\'ve somehow managed to kill only one of my three crewmembers. This is a momentous occasion for the KSP. Casualty rates are down 66%

...

just saw a thread about this game on my motorbike forum

...

I think you\'ll find it\'s MY motorbike forum.....
